alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 28 at 9:18PM CDT until May 28 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN SMITH...SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHEASTERN HARLAN COUNTIES... At 918 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Franklin to near Bloomington to near Harlan County Dam, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Republican City, Naponee, Bloomington and Harlan County Dam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
